Current Status 2010: Spots backfilled over line on new RoW has settled in some spots and water is pooling, topsoil may be require to be brought in to fill these spots, or re grading. Land owners drainage ditch was not contoured back to grade and water is not running through it but pooling in it instead.  Re-contour soil on new RoW, topsoil may be required to be brought in to fill these spots. Re-contour drainage ditch to allow water to move without pooling. - Spring thru Fall 2011
Current Status 2011: Field was not land levelled in 2011 due to lack of specialized equipment availability.
Current Status 2012: •  Field was not land levelled in 2012. •  Although work is required to address uneven contours, there are no known crop production issues at these locations.
Current Status 2013: •  Field was not land levelled in 2012. •  Land-leveling work is required to restore field surface contours.
Current Status 2014: • Land levelling was completed during summer / fall 2014. • Land-levelling work was required to restore field surface contours.
Recommendations/Schedule for 2015: Monitor in 2015

Current Status 2010: Minor soils mixing during the topsoil stripping and site access components. Site cleanup in 2010 uniformly replaced topsoil across affected portions of the right-of-way. As additional cleanup to correct deficiencies was completed as various times in the growing season, seeding of crops and associated productivity could not be quantified. Although early indications show no further concerns, assessments will be conducted at the appropriate time in 2011 to determine if additional remediation is required
Current Status 2011: SSites assessed prior to seeding, during growing season, before harvest and after harvest. Crop production same as off right-of-way in majority of site, with small locations of slightly more sparse crops.  ubsidence observed in 2011 assessments, with most completed.
Current Status 2012: •  Sites were assessed in Spring/Summer 2012.  •  Soils were similar on and off right-of way, as well as on the right-of-way on non-disturbed areas.  •  Crop production was no different over these areas than off ROW and on ROW in other non-disturbed areas. •  Subsidence areas were stripped and re-graded for repair •  In other areas topsoil was uneven and was disked and levelled. •  No further work required.
Current Status 2013: •  Sites were assessed in Spring 2013. •  Soil continues to be similar on and off right-of-way, as well as on the right-of-way on non-disturbed areas. •  Stubble density consistent on and off right-of-way, as well as on the right-of-way in non-disturbed areas •  No issues raised by landowners •  No work required
Recommendations/Schedule for 2015: No issues. PCEM is considered to be complete.
